entry.title: TRUE WEALTH 01.20.26
entry.summary: Presented by Littlejohn Financial, David Littlejohn and Matt Dickson have our weekly local financial program.

entry.title: Stewart Park Drive Bridge in Roseburg closes for inspection Thursday
entry.summary: Stewart Park Drive Bridge will be closed for a maintenance inspection on Thursday, Jan. 22.

entry.title: INSIDE DOUGLAS COUNTY 01/20/26
entry.summary: Dr. Liz Fiedler Mergen talks about her grief journey following the death of her husband right before she found out she was pregnant in 2020. Her book “Flowers Bloom Anyway” is out soon and is available for pre-order from Barnes and Noble.

entry.title: NLRB Dismisses Union Complaints Against Bigfoot Beverages, Company Says
entry.summary: Bigfoot Beverages says the NLRB dismissed seven unfair labor practice charges filed by Teamsters Locals 206 and 324, calling them lacking in merit. The strike began Sept. 19, 2024, and continues as the labor dispute remains unresolved.

entry.title: Police Log: January 16 - January 20, 2026
entry.summary: Roseburg police reported multiple arrests Jan. 16 to 20, including DUII cases, warrants and parole violations, alleged assaults and harassment, restraining or no contact order violations, theft at WinCo, and several criminal mischief and prohibited camping incidents, according to city logs.

entry.title: MORNING CONVERSATION 01.20.26
entry.summary: State Representative Boomer Wright talks about his plans to retire from the Oregon State Legislature after this term. He talks about his work in Salem and plans for the future.

entry.title: MLK Day of Service Brings Roseburg Together for River Cleanup and Invasive Species Removal
entry.summary: Roseburg volunteers marked MLK Day with hands-on service across Stewart Park, Eastwood Nature Park, and the Duck Pond, removing trash, pulling invasive plants, and installing educational signs as part of Umpqua Watersheds’ annual restoration event.

entry.summary: January 20, 2026 4:00 a.m. A Dense Fog Advisory remains in effect through 12:00 p.m. Tuesday for central Douglas County. Forecasters at the National Weather Service in Medford said visibility of one quarter of a mile or less in dense fog is expected. Low visibility could make driving conditions hazardous.

entry.title: MYRTLE CREEK CITY COUNCIL MEETING ON TUESDAY NIGHT
entry.summary: January 20, 2026 3:40 a.m. The Myrtle Creek City Council will have a meeting Tuesday night. Councilors will vote on collective bargaining agreements with the International Brotherhood of Electrical Workers- which represents most city staff, and with the Myrtle Creek Police Officer’s Association. entry.title: INSIDE DOUGLAS COUNTY 01.19.26
entry.summary: On this Martin Luther King Jr. holiday, we re-aired the famous “I Have a Dream Speech, delivered in 1963 by the Reverend Martin Luther King Jr.

entry.summary: A Beginning Youth Shotgun Skills event will be held all day Feb. 14 at the Roseburg Rod and Gun Club, 875 Old Del Rio Road in Roseburg. The event is put on by Friends of the NRA and Douglas County…

entry.title: Oregonians welcome to nominate teachers for Oregon Regional Teacher of the Year
entry.summary: The Oregon Department of Education, in partnership with the Oregon Lottery, will accept nominations for Regional Teacher of the Year through Feb. 11.

entry.title: University of Wisconsin-Madison recognizes Combs on dean's list
entry.summary: The University of Wisconsin-Madison recognized students who achieved the dean's list for the fall semester of the 2025-26 academic year.

entry.title: 2026 Celebration of Literacy Poster Contest opens submissions
entry.summary: The Umpqua Literacy Council opened the 2026 Celebration of Literacy Poster Contest for all students from kindergarten through fifth grade. Posters are due Jan. 30.

entry.title: Hoshowski named on York University dean's list
entry.summary: York University announced 180 students listed on the Fall 2025 Term Dean's List. Moriah Hoshowski of Roseburg was named on the list.

entry.title: Bigfoot Beverages cleared of multiple labor complaints raised by striking workers
entry.summary: The National Labor Relations Board (NLRB) has cleared Oregon-based drinks distributor Bigfoot Beverages of several accusations that it violated labor law.

entry.title: MORNING CONVERSATION 01.19.26
entry.summary: U.S. Senator Ron Wyden is back in Oregon for a series of Town Hall meetings. He joins to talk about Greenland, NATO, the recent passage of Secure Rural Schools legislation, wildfire legislation and other topics.

entry.title: Umpqua River Lighthouse celebrates over 130 years of operation
entry.summary: WINCHESTER BAY — In 1894, the wick of the rebuilt Umpqua River Lighthouse was lit for the first time, guiding sailors through the mist and fog of the Oregon coast.

entry.title: Sustainability, creativity, drinkability: Inside Stillwagon Distillery
entry.summary: Reedsport’s Stillwagon Distillery is an institution of two personalities. On one side, guests are welcomed into the easygoing tasting room, a tiki bar that feels like it was picked up from a tropical island and dropped onto the Oregon coast.

entry.title: MARTIN LUTHER KING JR. HOLIDAY MEANS CLOSURES
entry.summary: January 19l 2026 3:40 a.m. Monday is the Martin Luther King Jr. holiday and that means there are a number of closures. Federal, state, county and city offices are not open. Regular mail will not be delivered. School is not in session. Banks and credit unions are closed. Many professional offices will be shuttered. Most...

entry.title: COW CREEK UMPQUA INDIAN FOUNDATION GRANTS $795,000 TO NON-PROFITS
entry.summary: January 19, 2026 3:20 a.m. On Thursday, the Cow Creek Umpqua Indian Foundation celebrated its winter awards ceremony at Seven Feathers Casino Resort. A foundation release said $759,930 was distributed to southern Oregon non-profit organizations that work to strengthen their communities. The grants were awarded to groups in Douglas, Jackson, Josephine, Coos, Klamath, Lane and...

entry.title: AUDUBON SOCIETY/ROSEBURG LIBRARY TO HOST GREAT HORNED OWL PRESENTATION

entry.title: CITY OF ROSEBURG WITH COMMISSION VACANCIES
entry.summary: January 19, 2026 2:50 a.m. The City of Roseburg has vacancies on three city commissions and is now accepting applications from those interested in serving. A city release said the Budget Committee, Homeless Commission and Public Works Commission all have openings. The application for the Budget Committee is March 13th. Applications for the other commission...

entry.title: Cow Creek Umpqua Indian Foundation Awards $759,930 to 93 Southern Oregon Nonprofits
entry.summary: The Cow Creek Umpqua Indian Foundation awarded $759,930 in grants to 93 nonprofit organizations across seven Southern Oregon counties during its winter awards ceremony at Seven Feathers Casino Resort. Total giving since 1997 is now $27.2 million.

entry.title: DENSE FOG ADVISORY FOR CENTRAL DOUGLAS COUNTY UNTIL 12:00 P.M. MONDAY
entry.summary: January 18, 2026 1:50 p.m. A Dense Fog Advisory is in effect until 12:00 p.m. Monday for central Douglas County. Forecasters at the National Weather Service said visibility of one quarter of a mile or less in dense fog, especially over elevated roads is expected. Forecasters said low visibility could make driving conditions hazardous.
